column4: Hey all, the package updater for my system (Ubuntu 9.04) and it gets stuck installing a couple packages. It downloads them, but gets stuck installing them. What should I do?
Hey all, is there any way to very forcibly remove a problematic package? (Short of having to hunt down the files on the system)
dpkg -r --force-all will reconfigure your whole system.
a lot of dialogs will apear. a lot of
I ran into an error message with that command. ' --remove needs at least one package name argument". Do I need to find the package names?
i didn't get the whole story. plz wait a minute and i see if i can help
yeah. just fill in your package name
How do I find the exact names of the packages?
Nevermind, I think I know how to bring 'em up
you want to uninstall an package without knowing the package-name ? right ?
Uh.... well, no, I think I can find the package names
I just needed to know the exact package names.
I tried the command. It looks like it's stuck trying to remove the package
sorry pal, need to get some sleep. hope you solve your problem :) @all: cya
np, Thank you for your help!
